resources.string: Do you choose to receive email and update notifications in the privacy policy? Please indicate below if you would like to receive them.
Yes, I want to receive emails and notifications.
Update notifications will be displayed at: \n\"Support area > Privacy policy updates\".
Enter the child\'s name for formal communication purposes only.

By checking the box below, you agree that the user is a child under 13; that you are the parent/legal guardian and resposible for the child\'s privacy; that you claim ownership of the child\'s data that is collected through the mobile device; and that you are acting on behalf of the child to protect their data.

SECURITY 

 Is Company Secure? 
 Company takes security seriously and cares about the integrity of your personal information. 

 Toy by Company are certified by the iKeepSafe Seal Program. To learn more, visit ikeepsafe.org. 

 Toys are built on top of a platform certified to UL-2900-2-2 standard for Cybersecurity. 

 We use commercially reasonable physical, administrative, and technological methods to transmit your data securely including HTTPS, SSL, and 128bit encryption. The data is stored using Amazon’s S3 cloud service (AWS infrastructure). While Amazon provides security around that infrastructure which prevents unauthorized access to it, just being on AWS does not guarantee security. Our engineers have implemented AWS in a fashion that enables us to avail of proper security processes. 

 Company follows all the best practices when it comes to security. We secure our infrastructure accounts, servers and databases with complex protocol and passwords. We preform automated deployments and security upgrades in order to minimize any possible "user error" when performing maintenance or upgrades. 

 We would like to stress again that we take the security of your data very seriously. In addition to taking all of the precautions and following best practices on our end, we have had independent third-party entities audit our system for security vulnerabilities, as well as follow COPPA compliance procedures. 

 If you have any questions, please let us know. We're here to help! 

 What personal information is collected from children under 13? 
 Users under 13 are expected to use the Company app under their parent/guardian's account. As a result, we do not knowingly collect emails or other contact information directly from children under 13. When children use Company app, audio recordings are captured as part of its use. 

 What controls do parents have over account information and content? 
 Children under 13 are not authorized to create their own accounts, but instead must use their parent's account. Therefore, parents have full control over all account information and content for children under 13. Parents may review and delete audio files in their account and may also permanently delete their accounts by emailing us at team@company.com. 

 When you set up your app user account, your password is encrypted. If you need to reset your password, you will need to confirm it via e-mail. 




PRIVACY 

 We're serious about keeping things private. 
 This page explains what kind of information Company, Inc. and its subsidiaries and affiliates (collectively, "Company") collects and stores, including Personally Identifiable Information (i.e., data that can be reasonably linked to a specific individual or household) in connection with the operation of the the Company app and our toys, the Mailmen™ and Toy™ (collectively, "Company Products"). 

 We want you to know that we will always: 
 *Be transparent about the different types of information we collect and how we use them. 
 *Ask your permission before sharing your Personally Identifiable Information with third parties for purposes other than to provide Company's services, and to do so only when we think they will provide you with a welcome additional service. 
 *Use best-in-class data security tools to keep your data safe and protect the Company Products from unauthorized access. 
 *ABy using this service, you agree to allow us to collect and process information as described below. 

 What information does Company ask for? 
 *Information input during toy setup using the Company app including name and image associated with the toy in use. 
 *Information input during toy setup in conjunction with the Companycloud in the Company app including your child's birthday, timezone, and soundbite of the child's name. 
 *To access your Company Product over the Internet from a smartphone or a tablet, you will need to connect it to your Wi-Fi network. During setup, we will ask for your Wi-Fi network name (SSID) and password to connect to the Internet. It will save this information on the device, along with your IP address, so that you can access it and control it from your smartphone or tablet, and so that it can communicate with Company servers and download software updates. 
 *Additionally, when you create a Company Account, we collect and store your email address. From that point forward, your email address is used for communications from Company You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login ID and password. Like most Internet sites, we routinely record log entries (including information such as your IP address) and technical information (such as your browser type and version) when your browser, mobile device or Company Product contacts our servers. These log files are used for troubleshooting and are stored on our cloud servers. 
 *Payment processing information is collected when you purchase through our site, though not stored beyond processing. 

 What information does Company collect? 
 *We record your Company device ID and software version as necessary. 
 *Once connected to your Wi-Fi network, your Company Product regularly uploads to Company cloud servers the data mentioned above (excluding your Wi-Fi password) to provide you with the service. Incoming and outgoing messages are stored in the Company app for your retrieval and playback. 
 *Cookie and Usage Data for us with Google Analytics. 
 *Email addresses when you sign up to the Company Email list. 

 How does Company use the information it collects? 
 We use this information to provide and improve Company Products and services. We may use your email address to send you this information, or to ask you to participate in surveys about your Company use. We use service providers to perform some of these functions. Those service providers are restricted from sharing your information for any other purpose. 

 We use industry-standard methods to keep this information safe and secure while transmitted over your home network and through the Internet to our cloud servers. 

 How long does Company save my personal information and how can I delete it? 
 Company stores your Personally Identifiable Information on Company's cloud servers for as long as you remain a Company customer in order to provide you with the service. As described above, some information is stored directly on the Company device. All information is encrypted and cannot easily be accessed. You can delete the information on the Company device by deleting the associated child from your app. 

 You have the right to review, have deleted and/or refuse to permit further collection or use of your child’s information. If you refuse collection of data or stop further collection your child will no longer be able to send voice messages via their Toy. 
 To delete your Personally Identifiable Information from Company's servers, please request this in writing from the same email used to create your Company account. Because of the way we maintain certain services, after your information is deleted, backup copies may linger for some time before they are deleted. 

 Please send requests about information collected or deletion requests to our main operator: 
 Company will notify customers of any material change in the collection, use, or disclosure practices to which they have previously consented. 

 Empresa, Inc 
 XXX Street Road #XXXX 
 City, XX 12345 
 team@empresasa.com 
 0-123-745-6788 
 If you have additional questions or have a complaint related to our privacy policy and practices, please contact COPPAprivacy@iKeepSafe.org Company will notify customers of any material change in the collection, use, or disclosure practices to which they have previously consented. For complete information, please review our TERMS OF USE page. 


 THIRD-PARTY PROVIDERS 

 We're serious about keeping your information safe and secure. 
 Under no circumstance do we share Personally Identifiable Information for any commercial or marketing purpose unrelated to the delivery of Company Products and services. Period. We do not rent or sell our customer lists. 

 Our service technicians and other Company employees have supervised access to your information so they can answer your questions if you contact us for help and so they can monitor our servers for technical problems. 

 Except as described herein, we will only provide Personally Identifiable Information about our users to a third party if required to do so by law, or in the good-faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with state and federal laws or respond to a court order, subpoena, or search warrant. 

 We may share your aggregated and anonymous information in a variety of ways, including to publish trends and improve our system. We've taken steps to ensure that the information cannot be linked back to you and we require our partners to keep all information in its anonymous form. 

 Your personal information may be collected, processed and stored by Company or its service providers in the United States and other countries where our servers reside. As a result, your personal information may be subject to legal requirements, including lawful requirements to disclose personal information to government authorities, in those jurisdictions. If you select an outside party for the purchase, installation, or service of your Company device and share your personal information, we cannot control the collection, storage or sharing of information collected by that party. For example, if you bought your toy from a retailer, they may collect personal information as part of the transaction. Or the party that installed the device may retain information that you provided to them to assist them in servicing the device if needed. Always check the privacy policies for any company that collects your personal information. 

 In order to help Company provide, maintain, protect and improve our services, Company shares information with other partners, vendors and trusted organizations to process it on our behalf in accordance with our instructions, and any other appropriate confidentiality, security or other requirements we deem appropriate. These companies will only have access to the information they need to provide Company service. 

 You can find information on these partners and service providers we work with below, including what data we share with them or they provide to us, the service the provide for Company and links to their respective privacy policies. This list may change over time, and we’ll work hard to keep it up-to-date. If you have any questions, please get in touch here. 

 AWS for providing servers, databases and network infrastructure for storage, service delivery and other related services. 
 *Info Shared: All customer data related to the Company application is stored on Amazon Web Services. 

 mLab for managing the database services (the data itself is stored on AWS). 
 *Info Shared: All customer data related to the Company application is stored in databases managed by mLab. All personal data is stored in databases residing in AWS. mLab provides tools to manage the scaling, backup, and maintenance of these databases. 

 Asana for managing our technical support tickets. 
 *Info Shared: Customer information (email, device id) and other details related to customer issue like logs. 

 Freshdesk for managing our technical support tickets. 
 *Info Shared: Customer information (email, device id) and other details related to customer issue like logs. 



EU DATA SUBJECTS 
 This section applies solely if you are an individual located in the European Union or any jurisdiction in which the General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR") (or a law or regulation implementing the General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679) ("EU Data Subject"). 

 Data Controller 
 Company is the data controller for processing of Personal Data (as defined in the GDPR) of our Customers and job applicants. We act as a data processor on behalf of Customers when we process any end users Personal Data for the purpose of providing the Service to Customers in accordance with the applicable Customer contract. 

 Your Rights 
 For Personal Data that we process as a data controller, you may have the following rights in relation to your Personal Data, depending on applicable law: 

 Right of access If you ask us, we will confirm whether we are processing your Personal Data and, if so, provide you with a copy of that Personal Data (along with certain other details). 

 Right to rectification If your Personal Data is inaccurate or incomplete, you are entitled to ask that we correct or complete it. 

 Right to data portability You may have the right to obtain the Personal Data we process about you in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format, and to reuse it elsewhere. 

 Legal Bases 
 The legal bases for using your information as set out in this Privacy Policy are as follows: 

 *Where use of your information is necessary to comply with a legal obligation under EU Member State law (e.g., to provide information to EU tax authorities about revenue and purchases originating in the EU) 
 *Where use of your information is necessary to perform our obligations under a contract with you (for example, to comply with: the terms of service of our websites which you accept by browsing the websites/registering; and/or our contract to provide our Service to you); or 
 *Where use of your information is necessary for our legitimate interests or the legitimate interests of others (for example, to provide security for our websites, products, software, or applications; operate our business and our Services; make and receive payments; comply with legal requirements and defend our legal rights; prevent fraud and to know the customer to whom we are providing Services). 
 *Where we have your consent to engage in a particular processing activity. 

 Important: This privacy policy has been translated and adapted from ToyMail Co toy company, available at: https://toymail.co/pages/privacy
I have read and agree to the terms.

Classify child privacy risks to assist parents in their decision making in creating privacy rules. This classification can be performed based on statistical or machine learning techniques such as generative probabilistic models. Privacy risks can, for example, be listed by frequency of occurrence or degree of threat. \n\n Functionality not implemented.

Explain to parents about restrictions that some features of the toy may present if certain types of very restrictive privacy rules are created. 

 For example, if a toy provides a dialog functionality, i.e., it uses voice-capturing audio services, processes the received data and sends the response: creating a privacy rule that restricts audio capture and send operations may compromise the whole functionality. 

 Functionality not implemented.
Access here materials with guidelines on child privacy risks as well as content to better understand the use of the tool. \n \n New materials frequently added.
Access here important links for access.

Functionality to record the history of all activities performed by the child using the smart toy, including recording conversations with the toy (if the toy has a microphone), and making this activity history available for parental access (including recorded conversations). \n\n Functionality not implemented.

Functionality to apply natural language processing and pattern recognition techniques in dialogues between the child and the smart toy to alert parents immediately if suspicious subjects spoken by the child are identified, if desired by parents. 

 For example, words like drugs, gun, death, harassment, blood, sex etc. 

 Functionality not implemented.
Chat for quick and easy communication with the company. \n\n Select below the conversation subject:
Access here answers to users\' main questions regarding the toy and the parental control tool. \n\n New questions frequently added.
Are you sure you want to deactivate your user account? \n\n All configuration data as well as registration data and collected PIIs will be deleted.

You may ask the company to delete sensitive and identifying information collected from your child during their interactions with the toy so far. 

 To do this, you need to write a justification in the box below explaining the reason for the request. 

 After the request has been made, the company will evaluate the justification and then return the decision via email.
The company will send you an email with the response to the request.
Here are some predefined privacy rule templates to use, or if you prefer you can look for an external template.
This option enables the user to search (.xml file) predefined privacy rule templates external the the tool (third party). \n\n Functionality not implemented.

Do you confirm the selection of the rule template? 

 By confirming, you enable the rule for use, which will be added to your privacy rules list under "Manage rules". 

 Functionality not implemented.

You need to create the \"access control\" for the privacy rule. For example, for a rule where \"subject A can capture file B\", then \"subject A\" is the \"mobile service\", \"file B\" is the \"object\", and \"capture\" is the \"operation\".
Mobile service is a service provided by the toy to perform part of its functionality. \n\n Each mobile service needs to access different types of data objects for its operation.

Operations are actions that mobile services can perform on data objects, as follows: 

 Capture: allows the object to be read, i.e., data to be captured from the object (for example, audio to be captured from a microphone, a photo to be taken from a camera, a geolocation position to be captured from a GPS etc.) . 

 Send: allows data to be written to the object, i.e., data to be sent to the object (for example, audio to be sent to a speaker, video to be sent to a screen etc.).

Objects represent the types of data that come from using the toy, i.e., captured/generated and stored by toy devices. 

 Important: denying permission to collect or use certain data objects may directly interfere with your child's experience with using the toy. 

 For more information, please visit: 
 "Parent area > Restrictions on use"

One purpose defines the reason for which the collected data may be used as follows: 

 Game: data applied to gameplay performance. 

 Personal: data applied to the user's use of the toy. 

 Marketing: data applied to commerce and business strategy. 

 Administrative: data applied to the internal administrative processes of the toy company. 

 Research: data applied to scientific research. 

 Any: any of the purposes listed above.

Recipient types represent the types of entities that will be allowed to receive the collected data, as follows: 

 Individual: the toy users themselves or a mobile service linked to the toy. 

 Group: a group of toy users (for example, for multiplayer toys). 

 Third: an external entity, restricted by the person responsible to the holder of the object to which access has been requested. 

 Any: any internal or external entity.

Obligations refer to policies that must be met to maintain access to data by data consumers. 

 These policies are generally linked to legislation and acts, including: 

 PIPEDA: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. 

 COPPA: Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act. 

 For more information on these acts, go to: 
 "Parent area > Useful links".

Retention represents how long you allow collected data to be retained: 

 No retention: requested data is not retained for more than a brief moment after which it will be destroyed without storage. 

 Stated purpose: requested data is retained only for the time necessary to fulfill the stated purpose and will be discarded as soon as the purpose is completed. 

 Legal requirement: requested data is retained only for a stated purpose as required by law or liability under applicable law. 

 Business practices: requested data is retained in accordance with the business practices stated in the tool's service terms (as contained in the "Support area"). 

 Indefinitely: requested data is retained for an indefinite period of time, as intended by the data consumer. 

 Custom: requested data is retained for the time determined by the user.
Do you want to disable this privacy rule and disable all its actions? \n\n This will not delete the rule, and it can be enabled again.
Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)

By clicking on the link, the user is taken to a page on the company website where the document specifying the conditions and rules for using the parental control tool services is presented. \n\n Functionality not implemented.
By clicking on the link, the user is taken to a page on the company website where the parental control tool privacy policy is presented. \n\n Functionality not implemented.
